docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail Steamship Arabia, Captain JUDKINS, arrived at her wharf in Jersey City, at 6 o'clock yesterday morning, having sailed from Liverpool on Wednesday, the 9th inst., at 10 1/4 o'clock, A. M. The trip will, no doubt, prove a serious disapointment to the proprietors, as extraordinary efforts had been made to have it a trial of speed.

docs.lead_paragraph: I return again to the affair of the arrests that excited so much interest last February. You will remember that some thirty or forty persons were arrested on the first Sunday of that month on suspicion, it was said, of conspiracy against the State and of propagating false news,

docs.lead_paragraph: By invitation of Mr. SAMUEL, BRANNAN, a large assemblage of Californians was had last evening, at the St. Nicholas Hotel, where they were entertained most sumptuously, and enjoyed a convivial repast worthy to be regarded as a biennial observance of the grand festival of 1851.

docs.lead_paragraph: The telegraph announces the not unlooked for event, which deprives the Nation of its regently elected Vice-President. It was known at an early day after the Presidential election, last November, that a pulmonary disease had made such inroads upon the constitution of Mr. KING, that the chances were against his surviving through the term for which he was elected. As the late session of Congress,

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times Sonic and Slidell--Borland Declines to be Governor of New-Mexico. The Gardiner Trial. Washington Items--Appointments, &c. w Important from Texas--The Gold Discoveries Confirmed--Great Excitement. Marine Disasters. The New-Orleans and Key West Mail LineFather Gavazzl In Baltimore. Attempted Murder. Movements of southern Steamers. Marine Report. Destructive Fire at Medford. Loss of Bark Geo. D. Smouse. Strike of Waiters in Philadelphia. Suicide at Savannah. The Bank Basis Bill-Governor Seymour. The Empire City at New-Orleans.

docs.lead_paragraph: The charge that Senator SOULE bargained with Mr. SLIDELL is wholly without foundation. Mr. SOULE yesterday telegraphed to the NewOrleans Delta, as follows: I have not spoken to SLIDELL in five years; have not even seen him here. I am not and cannot be for his election to the Senate. My appointment to Spain was deter.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; DEATHS. THE LATE EXPLOSION. THE ATHENAEUM. COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER PETIT LARCENY A JUVENILE DRUNKARD. LARCENY. POLICE COURT CIRCUIT COURT CALENDAR

docs.lead_paragraph: DEATHS.--The Health Physician reports the whole number of deaths, for the week ending April 16, to be 55. Of this number, there were 33 males, and 22 females; 20 adults, and 35 children.
docs.snippet: DEATHS.--The Health Physician reports the whole number of deaths, for the week ending April 16, to be 55. Of this number, there were 33 males, and 22 females; 20 adults, and 35 children.

headline.main: WALKS AMONG THE NEW-YORK POOR.; Rotten Row."

docs.lead_paragraph: Tile Eighth Ward is not, by any means, one of the poorest districts of the City. Its population, numbering some 36,000, are none of them very wealthy; yet, there are many substantial, well-todo people among them. There has not been as much open vice there as in other quarters.

headline.main: English Society as Painted by Thackeray.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hope Chapel was crowded last evening to hear Mr. HUNTINGTON, the author of Albans, Lady Alice, , on English Society as painted by THACKERAY. Beside the lecturer, on the platform, were the Bishop of Pittsburg and Archbishop HUGHES. The lecturer apologised for disappoint.

headline.main: ENGLAND.; The Eastern Holidays--Politics--Turkey--The Sunday Question--The Merchants' Address to the Emperor--The Rappers--Black, Red, and White"--Literary Matters, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Easter, as far as London is concerned, is the signal of an annual explosion of gaiety ; it is the season when the smoke dried denizens of the Metropolis deem it right to relax a little of their habitual sombreness, and, as old FROISSART says, " amuse themselves sadly after their fashion."
